- Topic: Ordinance Amendments in Section 70 of the City Code
- Summary: This ordinance aimed to amend and reordain Division 1 of Article II in Section 70 of the Code of the City of New Orleans. Two ordinances were proposed, both recommended for approval by the Budget/Audit/Board of Review Committee and adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33689 and 33690
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
    Vote 2: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)

- Topic: Survey of Juvenile Intervention Services
- Summary: This motion proposed to initiate a survey of existing City or Juvenile Court administered and funded juvenile intervention services programming, budgetary allocations, and the entities responsible for execution and oversight of said programming. The motion was referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee, who recommended approval, and it was subsequently adopted.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-158
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee, who recommended approval, and it was subsequently adopted.
- UID: c02d4f79-f7b4-49be-8a74-4a07f0209d4c

- Topic: Amendment to Classified Pay Plan (Library)
- Summary: The amendment to the Classified Pay Plan (Library) was submitted for Council approval, with changes to hiring rates for various library positions. The amendment was adopted.

- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Appointment to Industrial Development Board
- Summary: The appointment of Ernest Gethers to fulfill the unexpired term of Eugene Green as a member of the Industrial Development Board was ratified, confirmed, and approved. The appointment is effective upon approval by the Council of the City of New Orleans for a term expiring on January 1, 2027.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-198
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The appointment of Ernest Gethers to the Industrial Development Board was ratified, confirmed, and approved.
- UID: a8a27771-bcde-4935-b191-628b19ae79f3

- Topic: Amendment of Domicile Requirement for Certain City Employees

- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,633

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Sale of Property in Metairie Park Subdivision
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the sale at public auction of a certain portion of ground in the 7th Municipal District, Square 34, Metairie Park Subdivision, which is no longer needed for public purposes. The minimum price will be set by appraisal. 
- Ordinance Number: 33670 - 29005 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed, authorizing the sale of the specified property at public auction.
- Tags/Keywords: Property sale, Public auction, Metairie Park Subdivision
- UID: 3acfdce0-7d71-4d95-a76d-5c0555a18687

- Topic: Amendment to Section 6-39 of the City Code
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to amend and reordain Section 6-39 of the Code of the City of New Orleans, regarding administrative adjudications for violations of various ordinances. It aims to eliminate a requirement regarding the application of collected monies. 
- Ordinance Number: 33665 - 29002 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment Passed - (2 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment to Section 6-39 of the City Code was passed, eliminating a specific requirement related to the application of collected monies.
- Tags/Keywords: City Code amendment, Administrative adjudications, Code of New Orleans
- UID: 3acfdce0-7d71-4d95-a76d-5c0555a18687

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Article IV, Section 4-106 of the Home Rule Charter
- Summary: An ordinance calling for an election to approve an amendment requiring Council approval for mayoral appointments to various offices, departments, commissions, and boards. The amendment covers appointments outlined in the Home Rule Charter and those created after its establishment. The ordinance was referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee, and there were speakers both in opposition and support of the ordinance.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,625 - BY: COUNCILMEMBERS MORRELL AND MORENO
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: As Amended - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed after being amended, and it was electronically submitted with a technical correction needed.
- Tags/Keywords: Amendment, Home Rule Charter, Council Approval, Mayoral Appointments
- UID: 54b2a049-86a8-4f7a-80c7-7d4f2eeab79d

- Topic: Conditional use for secondary educational facility in historic residential district
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish a conditional use to allow components of a secondary educational facility in specific residential districts. The ordinance was discussed, and various speakers expressed opposition and support. An amendment was proposed and passed.

- Votes Summary:
    - Amendment: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Limiting Mayor's Power to Suspend Article X
- Summary: The ordinance aims to limit the power of the Mayor to suspend Article X of Chapter 2 of the City of New Orleans Code. It was continued to the meeting of 5/5/22 and referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,671
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: As Amended - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)

- Summary: This ordinance seeks to amend and reordain Section 58-36 of the City of New Orleans Code regarding the establishment of election precincts. It was continued to the meeting of 5/5/22 and referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,679
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: As Amended - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)

- UID: 9acdf044-bcfa-4e66-a3d8-44734673a6d3

- Topic: Creation of Prostitution-related Crimes
- Summary: This ordinance aims to create and define the crimes of permitting premises for prostitution and concealment of prostitution in the City of New Orleans. It was continued to the meeting of 5/19/22 and referred to the Criminal Justice Committee.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,680
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Authorization for Flashing Beacon Operation
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the Parish of Jefferson to allow and facilitate the operation and maintenance of a flashing beacon on a certain stretch of Old Hammond Highway right-of-way as part of the Bucktown Connector Route and Signal Crossing Project.
- Ordinance Number: 33681
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)

The ordinance was withdrawn.

- Topic: Council's Authority on Internet Access and Smart City Initiative
- Summary: This resolution stated that any agreement related to increasing access to internet services and advancing the smart city initiative is subject to the Council's franchising authority. It also emphasized that any agreement related to the City's smart city initiative and the RFP should be a multi-year agreement subject to the Council's review and approval. The resolution was electronically submitted and the postponement deadline was 8/19/22.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-199
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The resolution was electronically submitted and highlighted the Council's authority in internet access and smart city initiatives.
- Tags/Keywords: Internet Access, Smart City Initiative, Council's Authority
- UID: 3bcb6e72-4219-49d8-b6f9-f34226b79894

- Topic: Commencement of Investigation into Procurement Practices of the Mayor's Office of Utilities
- Summary: The City Council passed Resolution R-22-201 to commence an investigation into procurement practices and activities involving the Mayor's Office of Utilities, including the selection of Smart+Connected NOLA for smart cities and public Wi-Fi deployment in New Orleans.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-201
- Votes Summary:

  - Vote 2: Adopt - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The City Council voted to suspend the rules and adopt the resolution to commence the investigation.

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Creation of Public Facing Dashboard
- Summary: The Department of Finance is tasked with creating and maintaining a public facing dashboard with metrics for key programmatic initiatives, categorized by seven (7) expenditure categories identified in the Orleans Parish: State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds 2021 Report.
- Ordinance Number: 33698
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (Unanimous)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed unanimously, authorizing the Department of Finance to proceed with creating the public facing dashboard.
- Tags/Keywords: Department of Finance, public facing dashboard, programmatic initiatives, expenditure categories
- UID: 481a727c-1bc0-43fc-8fc8-f8fc370d5900

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Richard Lee Playground
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the State of Louisiana for the planning and construction of the Richard Lee Playground improvements.
- Ordinance Number: 33699
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)

- UID: 481a727c-1bc0-43fc-8fc8-f8fc370d5900

- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into Amendment No. 2 to a previously executed Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for the planning and construction of a new S&WB Electric Substation at the Carrollton campus.
- Ordinance Number: 33700
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (9 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed unanimously, allowing the Mayor to proceed with Amendment No. 2 to the Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for the new S&WB Electric Substation.

- UID: 481a727c-1bc0-43fc-8fc8-f8fc370d5900

- Topic: Authorization of Election for Superintendent of Police Term and Removal
- Summary: The ordinance calls for an election on November 8, 2022, to authorize changes to the Home Rule Charter of the City of New Orleans regarding the term and removal of the Superintendent of Police.

- Topic: Waiver of Fees for Tornado Damaged Structures
- Summary: The ordinance aims to waive certain fees for building permits necessary to perform non-structural repair of structures damaged by the tornadoes that occurred in New Orleans on March 22, 2022.
